header_summary:
Antoine Riard has actively contributed to advancing the bitcoind build system and the libbitcoinkernel projects over the summer, focusing on enabling the historical bitcoin consensus engine to operate within a secure enclave to minimize security risks. The initiative led to the creation of a standalone repository for libbitcoinkernel, facilitating easier access and development for those unfamiliar with embedded systems' build systems, and is a step towards more secure and diverse bitcoin node implementations. This development, documented at [GitHub](https://github.com/ariard/standalone-bitcoinkernel), aims to provide a robust foundation for developers interested in full-node implementations or integrating the libbitcoinkernel into other parts of the bitcoin stack.

Andrew Toth proposes enhancements to the Partially Signed Bitcoin Transaction (PSBT) format to include support for silent payments, aiming to improve transaction privacy through additional data fields and revised roles for entities involved in the transaction process. This proposal, part of BIP 370, introduces technical specifications for integrating silent payments into the PSBT framework, enabling more private transactions on the Bitcoin network by leveraging cryptographic proofs, as detailed at [this source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/cde77c84-b576-4d66-aa80-efaf4e50468fn@googlegroups.com/T/#u#ma28015d36d7afba0a7738d191ef1d63074a9b25f).

Discussions led by roasbeef and ellemouton focus on enhancing the Bitcoin and Lightning Network protocols through the incorporation of MuSig2 adapter signatures and updates to the protocol proposal, emphasizing the transition to a Pure Type-Length-Value (TLV) format for improved information exchange and network efficiency. These discussions underscore the community's efforts towards refining the technology for better security, efficiency, and adaptability, reflecting ongoing developments in areas such as Taproot Lightning Channels and gossip message structures. The significant updates are documented at [DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/ln-summit-2024-notes-summary-commentary/1198/6) and [another link](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/updates-to-the-gossip-1-75-proposal-post-ln-summit-meeting/1202).

Lastly, accumulator introduces "Bundled Payments" to the BOLT12 specification, targeting improvements in non-custodial exchanges and submarine swaps, which are pivotal for secure blockchain transactions. This concept is aimed at enhancing transaction flexibility and security, with in-depth discussions and technical details provided at [Linux Foundation's mailing list](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/lightning-dev/2023-June/003977.html).

recent_posts.title: On Libbitcoinkernel Readyness
recent_posts.summary:
- Efforts were made to enhance bitcoind and develop libbitcoinkernel for secure bitcoin consensus.
- A repository with libbitcoinkernel resources is now public, aiming for broader accessibility and understanding.
- The project invites developer experimentation and feedback, highlighting its potential in bitcoin node implementations.

recent_posts.title: BIP: Sending Silent Payments in PSBTs
recent_posts.summary:
- This proposal enhances PSBT format to support silent payments for privacy improvement.
- Silent payments require new fields and revised roles for transaction participants.
- It integrates privacy into Bitcoin transactions using cryptographic proofs, updating PSBT standards.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Notes & Summary/Commentary
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion focuses on Bitcoin protocol enhancement, highlighting single signature and MuSig2 signatures development.
- Progress in MuSig2 integration for Bitcoin is noted, with a BIP proposal for signature construction anticipated.
- The implementation of PTLC and Taproot channels is underway, emphasizing network-wide efforts for efficiency improvements.

recent_posts.title: Updates to the Gossip 1.75 proposal post LN summit meeting
recent_posts.summary:
- The summit discussed updating the protocol, especially message structuring and announcement methods.
- Proposals include TLV format for messages and flexible P2WSH channel updates with Schnorr signatures.
- Implementation phases are suggested, with new feature bits to signal node capabilities and improvements.

recent_posts.title: Expanding on BOLT12
recent_posts.summary:
- The email introduces "Bundled Payments" for the BOLT12 specification.
- It highlights its use in enabling efficient, secure blockchain transactions.
- Links to technical discussions on the Linux Foundation's mailing list are provided.

active_posts.title: Proposal for Quantum-Resistant Cryptography in Bitcoin - BIP Submission
active_posts.summary:
- The BIP proposes integrating quantum-resistant cryptography into Bitcoin, using SPHINCS+ and Dilithium.
- It suggests modifications for quantum resistance, including a new address format and updated transaction structures.
- Agustín Cruz seeks community feedback on the proposal, emphasizing the importance of input for optimization.

active_posts.title: Redefine packages to discourage address reuse
active_posts.summary:
- Address reuse in Bitcoin transactions compromises privacy, prompting modification needs.
- A new transaction package definition could improve privacy by preventing address reuse.
- Implementing these changes faces obstacles like increased scanning times and adoption resistance.

active_posts.title: Hardforking Bitcoin to SLH-DSA (Future Proofing)
active_posts.summary:
- Transitioning Bitcoin to SLH-DSA is crucial due to quantum computing threats.
- SLH-DSA's larger signatures would impact Bitcoin's network and increase transaction fees.
- Despite challenges, SLH-DSA offers long-term security against quantum attacks.

active_posts.title: SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
active_posts.summary:
- The SuperScalar mechanism enhances Bitcoin Lightning Network liquidity without altering blockchain consensus.
- It utilizes Decker-Wattenhofer mechanisms, timeout trees, and laddering for security and efficiency.
- Implementation considerations include incentivizing user activity and structuring for cost-effective liquidity allocations.

active_posts.title: Ecash TIDES using Cashu and Stratum v2
active_posts.summary:
- Integrating BDHKE into Stratum v2 enhances privacy and auditability for small payouts.
- The process involves two-step communication for share submission and reward redemption.
- The proposal explores using Cashu for transactions and ASICs for computational efficiency.

active_posts.title: CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd `FindAndDelete` bug)
active_posts.summary:
- Niklas Gögge and Antoine Poinsot identified a critical flaw in Btcd's signature verification.
- Their discovery led to a bug bounty award and a fix in version 0.24.2 of Btcd software.
- The issue was responsibly disclosed in September 2024, highlighting community coordination and response.

today_in_history_posts.title: [BIP] Normalized transaction IDs
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Christian Decker updated the BIP with version numbers and Schnorr signatures.
- Decker is open to amending the proposal based on feedback.
- Luke Dashjr suggests wallets add outputs to unconfirmed transactions for fixes.

today_in_history_posts.title: [PATCH v3] daemon: encrypted communication (version 3)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network daemon's core functions include `decrypt_pkt()`, `encrypt_pkt()`, and `do_read_packet()`.
- New code updates feature added `io_data` struct and session key exchanges with encryption enhancements.
- The implementation introduces an `authenticate` packet and expands packet handling in peer connectivity and testing.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scalability involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for transactions.
- High transaction costs on the main chain push towards using interconnected off-chain services.
- Addressing correlated failures in second-layer solutions and enhancing security with tools like `OP_VAULT` is crucial.
